intro: Draba kjellmanii, commonly known as the Kjellman's whitlow grass, is a small flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbages, and is characterized by its tiny, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in cold, dry environments. It has a basal rosette of leaves and produces numerous small white or pale yellow flowers in early summer. Draba kjellmanii is often found in high-altitude meadows and is adapted to withstand harsh climatic conditions.
